column1: • Check the Revoked: field for a Yes or No value. If Revoked is Yes, type Y at the Resume Process line and press Enter to Resume the account only (if the New and Verify Password lines are left blank, the password will remain the same).

• To reset the password, tab to the New Password line and enter an 8 character password with at least one number (e.g. kaiser1, try2logn, etc.), then repeat for the Verify Password line and press Enter to create a temporary password.
• You will receive a Process Successful message in the upper right hand corner of the screen when the Password has been successfully reset or the user ID has been successfully resumed.

KMATE / KMATEWeb uses the same login credentials as the Windows CS domain (Active Directory). A Business Partner (BP) wishing to change his / her KMATEWeb password must change his / her Windows CS Domain password. Service Desk (SD) Analysts can assist with Windows CS Domain password resets if a BP is unable to log into KMATE.
A BP who has not accessed his / her KMATE account in over 60 days must request new access using KP Identity Manager (KPIM) and search for KMATE-TMS.
• Log into KMATEWeb and unlock BP's account.
• Advise BP to attempt log in using Windows credentials.
• If needed, reference Knowledge article KMATE - Unlock Account / Reactivate User Code.

column2: >Advise BP to log out of Windows
column3: log back in using same credentials and attempt logging into KMATE / KMATEWeb. If he / she is unable to log into Windows and / or KMATEWeb, perform Windows / Active Directory password reset.

column1: If the last successful login attempt has been within the last 45 day, open an Incident

column1: The above actions will send an email to your Customer
• The email the Customer receives provides a temporary password. Typically, that will be the username preceded by an ""@"" symbol. For example, ""@chapjr1""
<li>Logging into Lotus Notes with the temporary password will cause Lotus Notes to open and operate normally.&nbsp
To Change from the Temporary Lotus Notes password:
• In Lotus Notes, have the stakeholder click on File >
<li>The Customer will be prompted to type the temporary password.&nbsp
• Ask the stakeholder to click on the ""Change Password"" button.
<li>The Customer will again be prompted to type in the temporary password.&nbsp
<li>The Customer will then need to create a new password and enter it in twice.&nbsp
<li>The Customer should then click the OK button to save the changes.&nbsp
• The Customer may need to click the OK button on the next two windows to commit the change.

d7449c98870bc15065ea43f7cebb3591,KPWA,,KPWA - New user asking for Static Password,"
How to handle a call from a new KPWA user requesting a static password
• Reset the user through Active Directory tools or ARS
• Have users change password via KP Learn or another ACA powered login.

Currently there is a new hire process/packet in KPWA that is asking them to set up their CS domain access so that they can log into their accounts for training. These users are generally setting themselves up for their orientation or remote access.
• Reset a Windows / CS Domain password or unlock account via Active Roles Server (ARS) - KB0016407

***Note: Be sure to check the user's start date before providing a new password, as we are not to provide passwords for employees before their start date. If needed, the user's manager can call in and verify themselves to request a password for their upcoming employee as they will be accepting responsibility for anything that user does before the official start date.
Password resets should be resolved first level. If needed, suggested ticket assignment is IAM Active Directory.
8ff0d4978708d1d0764f337d0ebb3579,Password Resets,,Identity and Access Management - Password Reset Before New Hire Start Date in KPIM,"

The recommendation from the Identity and Access Management team, Cybersecurity and Technology Risk O?ice (TRO) o?ice is that although the password can be reset prior to the employee, provider (physician) or contractor&rsquo
column2: s start date, the password should not be communicated to the employee directly but rather to the employee&rsquo
column4: The manager can then move forward to provide this information to the employee, provider (physician) or contractor upon the start date. Granting access and relinquishing the password may be a risk since this is outside of their employment date with Kaiser Permanente (KP).

column1: Is it possible to have the start date be the date that these contractors are being asked to perform some training in preparation of their 1st day of work?

column2: >If the start date needs to be in the future, an alternative is to place a request for an Exception from the TRO Risk Exception group. This request should specify to allow these employees access prior to their start date. I recommend that the link to the web application is provided in the request.

column1: Please reference the Central Authentication Deviation section of the Risk Management Services - Operational Deviation site.

3d045bc9875c955493a285dd0ebb3589,iOS Devices,,How to Update Email Passwords on iOS/iPhone,"

How to update the Kaiser Permanente email password for an iOS/iPhone device. When updating a Windows/CS password, it is recommended to update your password on your iPhone with your newly created password. This will prevent your account from being locked repeatedly. You may receive a prompt stating: ""Password for Exchange account required"". This process will demonstrate how to resolve that prompt on your KP iPhone.

column3: >Click the Image(s) Below to Enlarge
column4: >Note: Image enlargement only works when viewing the article from the Service Portal.

column1: 1. From the iPhone or iPad, tap Settings.
If Device is using iOS 13 or prior, press Passwords and Accounts
5. A prompt to re-enter the password should appear.
Note: If not at a Kaiser facility, authentication through PingID will be required.
6. Enter the updated username and password.
• Opening the Mail application from the homescreen may also prompt a password update.
• How to Update Wifi on iOS/iPhone

c6b87a3987977050708843bd0ebb35a5,Access & Security,,New Password Requirements - Frequently Asked Questions,"

column6: >KP is requiring all staff to change their Windows/Mac login password.

column12: >first line of defense against unauthorized access<span class=""apple-converted-space""><span style=""background: white
column15: >to your computer and personal information. The stronger your password, the more protected Kaiser Permanente and your computer will be from hackers and malicious software.

column6: >What do I need to do to change my password?

column10: > while on the KP network or at a KP facility.

column6: >This is the password that you use to log in to your computer (laptop or desktop). This is also the same password that you use to log in to most KP web applications (including Global Protect).
>What are the requirements for creating a new password?

>Password length: Minimum of 12 characters
Password history: Cannot reuse any of your last 5 passwords
>My password already meets the criteria. Do I need to change it?
>Yes. If you have not executed a password change after 9/1/21, you will still need to create a new password.

column7: Will I need to reset it due to this change?

column6: >Yes, you will need to change your password after September 1<sup>st</sup>. Passwords are encrypted and can not to be reviewed to determine current length and strength.&nbsp
column7: However, we have enabled the capability to track adherence after our self-service password changes tools are changed to the new policy.

column6: >What are password best practices I can follow?
>Although not required, best practices you can follow include:

column3: >A non-alpha numeric special character (such as, $, #, or %)

column7: >What is the timing for the password change?

>The timing varies. The new criteria for passwords are being rolled out in phases across KP. If you do not change your password prior to your required date (as per the notification you will receive), then you will not be able to login to KP systems without changing the password first.

column6: >How often will I need to change my password?

column7: >There is no current password expiration in place. You will be notified if your password needs to be changed. If you suspect your ID or Password has been compromised, please follow the instructions to change your password immediately.
s time for me to change my password?

column8: >You will receive an email when it&rsquo
column9: s time for you to change your password.

column7: >Do I need to go into a KP office or facility to change my password or clear my cache?

column6: >No, you do not need to be in a KP office or facility to change your password or clear the cache. Once you successfully log into VPN (GlobalProtect), you just need to lock your workstation (on Windows, press CTR-ALT-Delete), wait a recommended five (5) minutes to allow the password change to propagate across all platforms, then unlock your workstation using your new password. If this doesn&rsquo
column7: t work, use your old password to log in. That will prompt a login event on the workstation, and the cache will automatically update.

column6: >How will this impact other devices such as my KP phone or iPad?
>For instances where you have stored your password in your device, you will also need to change it on the device.&nbsp
column7: This will be most common with O365/email.

column6: >What should I do if I change my password in the office and have a separate computer at home?
>Your home computer will not yet have your new password.&nbsp
column7: You will be able to initially log into your computer, but you will need to update to the new password prior to or when you connect to the KP network from home.
>What are the benefits of this change?

column6: >Using passwords that are more complex make it more difficult for hackers to infiltrate KP systems and data and therefore strengthens security for KP overall.

column7: >Do I or does my team need to do anything differently?
>Yes, you will need to change your Windows/Mac login password by the designated date to meet the new password criteria (you will receive an email with the date).

59d0f23487cb3c5097180fa40cbb354f,Mac as a Standard,,MacBook Admin Account Password vs KP Desktop Credentials,"<style type=""text/css"">

• If your KP Desktop credential password (which gets auto-filled from Remote Management) does NOT meet the Apple Admin account password criteria (cannon contain sequential or repeated characters, etc.)
• Then the MacBook will tell you your auto-filled password is invalid and you will have to make a different one
• Thus your MacBook admin password and your KP Desktop credentials are no longer synced

During enrollment, your regular KP password syncs into your Mac. There are requirements that macOS requires you to have that are more complex than Windows. As such you may be prompted to set a more complex password to move on.
column3: To set a new password, it must meet these requirements:

column1: • It must be at least 12 characters long.
• It must not contain repeating, ascending or descending character sequences.
• It must have at least 1 Letter and 1 Number.
Once you have set your password to satisfy these requirements, we recommend you change your password in the Kaiser environment on a PC to match this newer password.

column2: There is a macOS User Guide available online that can answer most of your macOS questions:&nbsp

Applies To
• User Segment: Contingent Worker, Corporate Worker, Day Extender, Executive
The following instructions are for the Service Desk (SD) to configure a Reflection session for UNIX password resets and unlocks. This should only need be done once if session settings are saved.
• Go to the SD shared drive (\\cscrdiefs001\Share\HELPDESK\Tools\Unix) and copy the UnixPasswordReset.rdox

column2: 1. Navigate to the following share drive:
2. Copy the UnixPasswordReset.rdox file to your desktop and launch it.
4. You will need to enter your NUIDa password three times, once in a dialog box, then twice in a command line.

column1: • Note: You can press Ctrl+V to paste in the dialog box, and right+click and select paste in the Reflections window.

column3: Save As, and save to your Desktop.

column1: • Note: The file on the share drive is Read Only, to prevent users from accidentally setting the connection information up for themselves consistently.
1. If the session appears to be configured (i.e., if you are prompted for your NUID, enter your NUIDa), proceed with the password reset / account unlock.
2. Ensure you save your session by clicking File >
column2: Save before leaving the session. Note: If the configured session does not ask for a User Name, follow these steps:

column1: • Cancel the login prompt. Note: If a message box appears reporting a communications or Netowrk Error occurred, press OK.
<li>Delete the NUID out of the User name field, or type in your own,&nbsp
column2: and click OK. The login prompt should now appear, and you will be asked to enter your NUID (Or enter in your password).
>2. On the Create New Template screen, select VT terminal from the Built-in templates. Compatibility should be set to Reflection Desktop.
>4. On the VT Document Settings screen, select Secure Shell in the Connection section.
>5. In the Host Name/IP Address field, enter arm.kp.org
>6. Enter your NUIDa in the User Name field. Note: If you wish for Reflections to ask for your NUID each time, leave the User Name field blank.

>7. In the Terminal section, Terminal type should automatically populate with VT500-7, and the Keyboard map field should display C:\Program Files\Attachmate\Reflection\Built-Ins\Keyboard Maps\default VT.xkb.
>8. Click OK. A Reflection Secure Shell banner appears.
>9. Click OK. Reflection prompts you to enter your CS domain password.
>10. Enter your password and click OK. The Reflection Workspace displays with last login information along with a $, followed by a prompt.
>11. Enter /opt/iamunix/scripts/kpitarm.sh on the prompt and press

>The Account Reset Welcome Menu screen appears, showing ""Welcome"".
Note: The text can be pasted in by right-clicking and selecting Paste, but NOT via CTRL+V.

>12. Enter your CS domain password three (3) times. You will then be taken to the IAM UNIX Account/Password Maintenance Menu screen, where you can reset passwords and unlock accounts.
Note: Entering the password three (3) times will only need to be done when you first launch the session for the day.

column3: Save before you exit the session, so you do not have to configure it again. You can save the session with a different name (e.g., ARM UNIX)

a9d6140187a7095800dba71e0ebb3595,Security,,Colorado Regional Data Store (CRDS) - Troubleshooting Password Reset Using Password Express,"

Objective
The CRDS application will be available on Password Express on June 26, 2019. Users of the CRDS Database will now be able to reset their own passwords, even if the account is currently locked.
• Application and Version(s): Colorado Regional Data Store (CRDS), Password Express
What are the possible issues a user could encounter and what action should the Service Desk take?
• Users must have an active account already set up in CRDS.
• If they do not, they will get the following error message when they try to reset their password:
• FAILURE The database reset failed. An exception occurred when attempting to reset the password for the user. ORA-01918: user 'T373983' does not exist

column2: >Resolution: The ServiceDesk should instruct the user to contact CDE-CO@kp.org to find out how to get set up for access in CRDS.

db4a01af87f85d10f03411373cbb354f,Mobile Devices,,Can't remember the password for your encrypted iTunes backup,"

Objective

column2: t remember the password for your encrypted iTunes backup
t restore an encrypted backup without its password. With iOS 11 or later or iPadOS, you can make a new encrypted backup of your device by resetting the password. Here&rsquo

column1: • Tap Reset All Settings and enter your device passcode.

• Follow the steps to reset your settings. This won't affect your user data or passwords, but it will reset settings like display brightness, Home screen layout, and wallpaper. It also removes your encrypted backup password.
• Connect your device to the Finder or iTunes again and create a new encrypted backup.
You won't be able to use previous encrypted backups, but you can use the Finder or iTunes to
column2: back up your current data and set&nbsp

column1: If you have a device with iOS 10 or earlier, you can't reset the password. In this case,
• If someone else set up your device, ask them for the password.

column2: instead. If you don't have an iCloud backup, you can&nbsp

• Laptop still allows old password when off KP Network

If the cached Windows logon password on a laptop is different from the one on the server, the Business Partner (BP) can log on locally but will have issues connecting to shared drives, or any other servers that require Windows authentication.

column3: >If the BP connects via remote access, locks the machine, and unlocks it (using their server-side Windows password, not the local one), the machine will authenticate with the server and get the correct password.

f7a83d4b8777f014ba26404d0ebb35d9,Telephony,,How to reset a KPWA IVR RX password (Interactive Voice Response Pharmacy Refill System),"<h3 >&nbsp
• User Segment: [Affiliates, Contact Center, Contingent Worker, Corporate Worker, Day Extender, Executive, Physician, Point of Care]
This system is used to refill pharmacy prescriptions by voice or a telephone keypad
The Helpdesk has been granted sub administrative authority to reset passwords.
If you are unable to access the site, refer to How to Request KPWA Pharmacy Call Center IVR Access for IT Service Desk Agents - KB0060455
1. Log in to the IVR Rx Refill Report and Configuration web site using your AD credentials: https://ivrrxrptweb.ghc.org.
4. Click on Application Administration and select Pharmacy Users.
5. Type in all or part of the last name and click the 'Filter' button.
6. The filtered results will be displayed.

The password will be reset to match the numeric Login ID, in this example the password is changed to match Login ID is 8425641.The next time the user calls in to get the IVR exception messages they will need to enter the new password and they will be prompted to create a new password of at least 8 digits.
3a135f858714515400dba71e0ebb352d,Password Resets,,iMPAX - Password Reset / User unable to log on,"
User is unable to login to iMPAX / states that his/her login information for iMPAX is not working.

column3: >Service Desk Analyst will instruct user to login using his/her CS domain/Windows account. Service Desk Analyst should confirm that the account is active and not locked or in need of a password reset.
>Locate the user's Windows account in Active Directory.

>
If the Windows account is active, and the password is valid (i.e. user can authenticate to other resources with this password), check the Member of tab in the user's Active Directory account and check if he/she is a member of the group CO APP PACS CLINICIANS.

>
Note: If you need to verify an Exempla employee's SSN for a password reset in AD and the person is not showing up in KPIM, you can check the person's ServiceNow profile.

>
If password reset does not work or account is not locked, user's account in Active Directory (for the CS Domain) could be missing access to the CO APP PACS CLINICIANS group.

>
Service Desk Analyst should verify the user's account, location, and contact information, and then create/submit an Incident ticket in ServiceNow using Active Directory as the Configuration Item (CI).

cbc24b2187454d10c3f2ff77cebb35f0,RACF Mainframe,,DSBS Password Reset - KPWA IBM Mainframe,"

Objective
• Reset DSBS, BlueZone, or IBM sessions passwords.
• Application and Version(s): DSBS, Bluezone, IBM Sessions
• Note: CTRL + H will also open the User ID Search
• If needed enter new Password and re-enter in Verify box
• Note: Password requirements for IBM are as follows:
• Must be 8 characters in length, no more, no less
• Vanguard Security Center - Configuration (KB0038348)
• If a ticket must be opened, please assign to IAM KP Washington
• If a ticket needs to be expedited or for a status request, please email kpwa.accessmanagement@KP.org
<li><strong>New Call Configuration Item / Business Application: DSBS I&amp
• Assignment for access issues: IAM KP Washington
<li><em>Verify users identity before resetting or unlocking users account.&nbsp
• Users may see a Windows security pop up and may log in as usual. The userID is just the KPWA ID (do not add GHCMASTER domain prefix). Password is their DSBS password.

995900b887e00150adb064ec0ebb35d1,Mainframe,,Mainframe password reset and unlock for NCAL,"

Objective
This article details the processes for RACF password resets and unlocks for the following areas / applications:

column4: >1. Launch the Extra Mainframe application. Type KPTPX and press the Enter key (your session may be setup to do this automatically). You will see a login screen.
>2. Type your user id and password then press the Enter key.
colspan=""2"">3. At the Mainframe Session Menu, type NTSOA in the Command prompt and press Enter OR select NTSOA from the session menu and press the Enter key.
>4. At the READY prompt type ISPF and press the Enter key.
>5. At the command prompt type in plp vra and hit the Enter key.

column1: 6. At the Vanguard Administrator screen type 6 in the Option prompt field and hit the Enter key.
*Note: If you do not see this screen, press F3 until you see this menu.

column3: and verify last 4 of SSN and proceed to unlock account by typing
column5: Resume Account Line. If account is hard revoked, escalate a ticket to suggested support team.

column1: 8. Enter a new 8-character alpha-numeric password on both the New Password and Verify Password fields and press Enter.

column4: >9. If completed successfully, the words Process Successful will appear at the top right corner of the screen. The user&nbsp
column5: should now be able to log&nbsp
